alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 11:11AM EST until December 22 at 8:12AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Black Creek At Quinby affecting Darlington and Florence Counties. For the Black Creek...including Quinby, Black Creek Nr Hartsville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek at Quinby. * WHEN...From Monday morning to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Floodwaters begin to affect one mobile home on Creekside Drive and continue to rise in yards. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Sunday the stage was 4.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 13.7 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by late tonight.
